txt.en:
'Well met! Are you heading west? If so, I have a boon to ask of you.

'Along the banks of the land masses in Wadewater grows a plant known to some as the flowering rush. The plant is edible, and I admit that my craving for it has brought me all this way!

'I was sent back here with my tail between my legs, however. The dread-turtles are too fierce and have a taste for the rushes as well! Please, if you are in that area, would you bring me back any of the rushes that you might find?'

'I feel the fool, tromping out all this way following the cravings of my stomach like one of the Stoor-folk. But if you are able to gather some of the rushes for me, it will not all have been for nothing!'
A small flowering plant found in Wadewater can make a quite delicious meal. If one can gather the rushes without falling astray of the ferocious turtles who call the area home.
You should bring the flowering rushes to Lindeth.\n\nLindeth is in Echad Terthas.
'Ah, you are most welcome back! I see the turtles were not too much for you to handle. I am looking forward to cooking these rushes up right away. You have my thanks.'
Lindeth has asked you to bring her back any flowering rushes that you might find in Wadewater.\n\nWadewater is in northern Swanfleet.
